parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To condemn, pass sentence upon. From kata and a derivative of dike; to adjudge against, i.e. Pronounce guilty.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To murder, kill. From phoneus; to be a murderer.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From dike; equitable; by implication, innocent, holy.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From anti and the middle voice of tasso; to range oneself against, i.e. Oppose.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
